snippet.textDisplay: Still one of my favorite JRPGs of all time.  Awesome soundtrack, unique battle system, great plot and the voice acting was that kind of terrible you get attached to.  Especially Ashton's terrible voice actor XD "Oooooh, The Almight Tria! Overthrow all the enemies!"
snippet.textOriginal: Still one of my favorite JRPGs of all time.  Awesome soundtrack, unique battle system, great plot and the voice acting was that kind of terrible you get attached to.  Especially Ashton's terrible voice actor XD "Oooooh, The Almight Tria! Overthrow all the enemies!"

snippet.textDisplay: Chrono Trigger and Final Fantasy 6 are two of my favorite games of all time, and they have their dramatic points, but it wasn't until playing this game on the PS1 that I really felt genuinely emotionally involved with the struggles of the characters.
snippet.textOriginal: Chrono Trigger and Final Fantasy 6 are two of my favorite games of all time, and they have their dramatic points, but it wasn't until playing this game on the PS1 that I really felt genuinely emotionally involved with the struggles of the characters.

snippet.textDisplay: I looooove Crystal Chronicles! But it's much more fun on multiplayer than it is on single player.
snippet.textOriginal: I looooove Crystal Chronicles! But it's much more fun on multiplayer than it is on single player.

snippet.textDisplay: The problem with the PS1 version was the godawful graphic design. While SO1 was nicely updated for its PSP-port, the SO2-port wasn't so much as fixed in any sense. So it really doesn't matter which platform you choose, the differences are hardly there. In fact, you could play the PS1-version on a PSP. ;)
snippet.textOriginal: The problem with the PS1 version was the godawful graphic design. While SO1 was nicely updated for its PSP-port, the SO2-port wasn't so much as fixed in any sense. So it really doesn't matter which platform you choose, the differences are hardly there. In fact, you could play the PS1-version on a PSP. ;)
